title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: Being certain that Leshe could not escape all the ambuscades prepared sor him in Fife, where Dobbie andand Trotter, with fifteen troopers from RedhaU, John ofClatto, with his lawless men, Lindesay of Bandon,with his ruffians, and lastly, Kincavd, a deadly fencerand professed duellist, were aU induced, under variousinstigations, and from various motives, to beset his path,Birrel kept but a careless watch, looking upon Leslie asone whom he had not the least expectation of seeing.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: Round and round him, they both rode in circles, butby point and edge, he met their cuts and thrusts; tiUobserving that Bandon was close to the edge of thestream, he suddenly put spurs to his horse, and charginghim with the utmost fury, by a blow of his foot forced himright over the bank, where his horse feU upon him, andwith its rider sank into the river.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: With a fervent, almost a ferocious prayer to Heaven, he drew his sword and awaitedthem, for at the first glance he discerned that one of thefour was his enemy Bandon, who, to breathe his pantinghorse, advanced leisurely at a trot, before his threeimmediate followers.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: Here tohalt was vain; for the unscrupulous Lairds of Clattoand Bandon had men enough to sack and destroy thewhole kirk-hamlet; so forward pressed the fugitive,intent on reaching the castle of Balgonie, or the ancientmansion of the Beatons of Balfour; wiiere the archbishop of St. Andrews and his nephew, the great cardinal, were born.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: Leslie was almost tempted to turn towards the moss ;but "o one so ignorant of its paths, such a measuremight prove a certain death, whde the risk was scarcelyless ii keeping near the barony of Bandon.

title: Jane Seton: or, the Kings Advocate. A Scottish historical romance
author: Grant, James
snippet: On, on he went by the skirts ofthe desolate and moonlighted moss, and his anxiety wasnot lessened by the reflection that he had to pass bythe Tower of Bandon, whose proprietor was his enemy;and in a few minutes he saw the square outhne of thisfortdice, with its angular turrets and grated window's, risingabove the roadway, among a group of old ash trees.
